data.title: Bill Gates Exits Microsoft Board To Focus On Philanthropy Full-Time, Ends An Era At The Company
data.text: It’s the end of an era at Microsoft. The giant company announced Friday that co-founder and Technology Advisor Bill Gates stepped down from the board of directors to dedicate more time to his philanthropic efforts, including global health, development, education and his increasing work tackling climate change.

data.title: Bill Gates, steps down from Microsoft board
data.text: Microsoft Corp co-founder Bill Gates, who made the company one of the world’s most valuable technology firms, stepped down from the board on Friday to focus on philanthropic works related to global health, education and climate change. The billionaire and his wife, Melinda, run one of the world’s largest charities, the Gates Foundation, which has.

data.title: Bill Gates leaves Microsoft’s board
data.text: Bill Gates has stepped down from the board of Microsoft to spend more time on his philanthropic endeavors, the company announced Friday afternoon. Though he will remain technology advisor to CEO Satya Nadella, this move reduces his involvement with the company to the lowest level it has ever been.

data.title: Pentagon Might Split Cloud Contract Between Microsoft, Amazon
data.text:
The Department of Defense move to reconsider the award of the JEDI cloud computing contract could lead to the Pentagon splitting the $10 billion deal between Microsoft and rival Amazon.
The post Pentagon Might Split Cloud Contract Between Microsoft, Amazon appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

data.title: Pentagon asks court for time to reconsider JEDI award to Microsoft
data.text: The JEDI contract award process might never be done. Following legal challenges from Amazon after the Pentagon’s massive, $10 billion cloud contract was awarded to Microsoft in October, the Pentagon indicated in court documents last night that it wishes to reconsider the award.

data.title: Pentagon to ‘reconsider’ Microsoft’s $10B contract amid Amazon beef
data.text: The Department of Defense has asked for four months to review parts of the $10 billion cloud-computing contract it awarded to Microsoft. Amazon, which along with its CEO Jeff Bezos has been publicly derided by President Trump, was considered the favorite to win the government contract, thanks to its Amazon Web Services cloud business.

data.title: Pentagon Wants to Reconsider Part of Controversial JEDI Award Process

data.title: Emergency Windows 10 Critical Security Update: Microsoft Urges Users To ‘Take Action’
